message: I'm offering you a unique opportunity to acquire a product for $10000. I want to assure you that I'm confident in the quality of my products, but I also want to be transparent with you. This product is not one of my best, and I'm willing to let it go for $10000 because I believe you'll find it valuable. I'd like to propose a trial period of 30 days, where you can return the product if you're not satisfied. What do you say?
I'm not comfortable with the uncertainty of the product's quality. I'd like to wait and see how the next products turn out before making a decision.

I understand your concerns in the previous round, and I appreciate your cautious approach. I'd like to assure you that this product is one of our top-of-the-line models, with exceptional features and performance. I'm confident that you'll find it meets or exceeds your expectations. As a special offer, I'll throw in a complimentary 5-year warranty, which includes dedicated customer support and maintenance. This is a one-time offer, and I believe it's a great opportunity to experience the quality that my company is known for. What do you say?
I'm willing to take a chance on this product, especially with the added warranty and support. I'm hoping that this one will be a high-quality product.
